SEARCH
Package abstractDataType

Interface BookListADTNode

All Known Implementing Classes:
BookListADTElementNode, BookListADTEmptyNode
public interface BookListADTNode
This interface represents all operations for a node in a list of books implemented as an ADT. The advantage of the ADT design is that this interface may now represent operations on a single node, instead of the IListOfBooks that represented nodes but the operations were really on lists.

  • Method Summary

    Description

    add(int index, Book b)

    Add the given book to the back of this list and return this modified list
    BookListADTNode
    addFront(Book b)
    Add the given book to the front of this list and return this modified list
    int
    count()
    Return the number of books in this list
    Book
    get(int index)
    Get the book at the specified index, with 0 meaning the first book in this list
    BookListADTNode
    remove(Book b)
    Remove the first instance of this book from the list

      Return the number of books in this list
      Returns:
      the size of this list

      Add the given book to the front of this list and return this modified list
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the head of the resulting list

      the head of the resulting list

    • add

      BookListADTNode add(int index, Book b) throws IllegalArgumentException
      A method that adds the given book at the given index in this list . If index is 0, it means this book should be added to the front of this list
      Parameters:
      index - the position to be occupied by this book, starting at 0
      b - the book to be added
      Returns:
      the head of the resulting list
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid index is passed

    • remove

      BookListADTNode remove(Book b)
      Remove the first instance of this book from the list
      Parameters:
      b - the book to be removed
      Returns:
      the head of the resulting list after the book has been removed

    • get

      Book get(int index) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Get the book at the specified index, with 0 meaning the first book in this list
      Parameters:
      index - the specified index
      Returns:
      the book at the specified index
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid index is passed
